string-array.name: quote_bodies
string-array.item: Men are more accountable for their motives, than for anything else; and primarily, morality consists in the motives, that is in the affections.
Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldnt be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesnt know it so it goes on flying anyway.
God made man to go by motives, and he will not go without them, any more than a boat without steam or a balloon without gas.
You cannot raise a man up by calling him down.
There are two levers for moving men -- interest and fear.
Striving for excellence motivates you; striving for perfection is demoralizing.
Life takes on meaning when you become motivated, set goals and charge after them in an unstoppable manner.
We are told never to cross a bridge until we come to it, but this world is owned by men who have crossed bridges in their imagination far ahead of the crowd.
Children, you must remember something. A man without ambition is dead. A man with ambition but no love is dead. A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive.
Very few people are ambitious in the sense of having a specific image of what they want to achieve. Most peoples sights are only toward the next run, the next increment of money.
Ambition -- it is the last infirmity of noble minds.
All ambitions are lawful except those that climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
Ambition. An overmastering desire to be vilified by enemies while living and made ridiculous by friends when dead.
No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
Great ambition is the passion of a great character. Those endowed with it may perform very good or very bad acts. All depends on the principals which direct them.
Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, youll land among the stars.
What I aspired to be and was not, comforts me.
Tis not what man does which exalts him, but what man Would do!
Ambition is not what man does... but what man would do.
There are only two ways of getting on in the world: by ones own industry, or by the stupidity of others.
The slave has but one master, the ambitious man has as many as there are persons whose aid may contribute to the advancement of his fortunes.
Ambition can creep as well as soar.
Like dogs in a wheel, birds in a cage, or squirrels in a chain, ambitious men still climb and climb, with great labor, and incessant anxiety, but never reach the top.
He who surpasses or subdues mankind, must look down on the hate of those below.
As falls the dew on quenchless sands, blood only serves to wash ambitions hands.
The men who succeed are the efficient few. They are the few who have the ambition and will power to develop themselves.
It is commonly supposed that the art of pleasing is a wonderful aid in the pursuit of fortune; but the art of being bored is infinitely more successful.
When you are aspiring to the highest place, it is honorable to reach the second or even the third rank.
